show.title: VHYes
show.headline: Press play on this offbeat coming-of-age comedy

event.title: <show-title>VHYes</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: A found footage kaleidoscope, with cast & filmmakers in-person!
event.description:
A bizarre retro comedy shot entirely on VHS, VHYES takes us back to a simpler time, when 12-year-old Ralph mistakenly records home videos and his favorite late-night shows over his parents‚Äô wedding tape. The result is a nostalgic wave of home shopping clips, censored pornography, and nefarious true-crime tales that threaten to unkindly rewind Ralph‚Äôs reality.

The crew of VHYES will join us for an in-person Q&A. Producer Delaney Schenker will attend the Q&As in Austin, and will be joined by filmmaker Jack Henry Robbins in NYC, DC, San Francisco, and L.A. Creator and director of photography Nate Gold will join the Q&As in San Francisco and L.A. Thomas Lennon will also join the Q&A in L.A.

Screening courtesy of Oscilloscope Laboratories & Hot Winter Films

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine‚Äôs hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin‚Äô tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We‚Äôll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, ‚Äúgold‚Äù necklaces to show you‚Äôre a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Movie Party. DOINK DE DOINK!

show.title: The Sacrifice
show.headline: Andrei Tarkovsky's final triumph

show.title: Death Becomes Her
show.headline: Keep young and beautiful ‚Äì or die trying!

event.title: <show-title>Death Becomes Her</show-title>
event.headline: Goldie Hawn & Meryl Streep slay the screen in this 1992 fatal femme cult classic
event.description:
‚ÄúNow, a warning‚Ä¶‚Äù

What would you do to stay young forever? This is an evergreen question in many cinematic and literary explorations, from Oscar Wilde to the copious vampire narratives we consume, from THE SUBSTANCE to Korean skincare TikToks hocking the perfect recipe for ‚Äúglass skin,‚Äù we are a species obsessed with delaying time's inevitable progression. Robert Zemeckis‚Äô 1992 black comedy (co-written by Journeymen screenwriter David Koepp and Martin Donovan) DEATH BECOMES HER is a classic example of this trope played out in gloriously campy fashion. Goldie Hawn and Meryl Streep are Helen Sharp and Madeline Ashton, two frenemies who compete in all things, especially for the attention and affection of dopey plastic surgeon Ernest Menville (played against type by a delightful Bruce Willis). When presented with a method of reversing and halting their aging by the gorgeous and mysterious vamp Lisle Von Rhuman (THE ICON Isabella Rosellini) both women seize the clandestine opportunity, and from there, things get grim and zany. Overflowing with subtextual sapphic angst and seething with a deep investment in the emasculation of cis straight men, this movie is a freaking blast! Groundbreaking Acadamy Award-winning special effects and hilarious performances from its entire cast helped launch DEATH BECOMES HER to cult classic status (especially amongst queer audiences) despite mixed reviews from critics. As Madeline would say, ‚ÄúScrew the critics‚Äù ‚Äì this movie is a STAR! Help us kick off the 2025 season of Queer Film Theory 101 with a dose of the potion with the motion. Stay beautiful, queerdos (but then again, you always are.)

show.title: Hippo
show.headline: A David Gordon Green/Danny McBride/Jody Hill-approved blast of cine-weirdness

event.title: <show-title>Hippo</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Live Q&A with the cast and crew
event.description:
Director/co-writer Mark H. Rappaport will attend the live Q&As in Austin and New York City. Joining Rappaport in NYC are actor/co-writer Kimball Farley and cinematographer William Babcock, moderated by executive producer David Gordon Green. Actor Eliza Roberts will attend the live Q&A in Los Angeles.

HIPPO examines the coming-of-age of two step-siblings: Hippo, a video-game-addicted teenager, and Buttercup, a Hungarian-Catholic immigrant with a love of classical music and Jesus. Like the Ancient Greek Aphrodite, Buttercup‚Äôs love is unrequited by a brother who prefers to indulge in the art of war and chaos.

show.title: Hot Rod
show.headline: Smack destiny in the face

event.title: <show-title>Hot Rod</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Our most stunt-y, daredevil-y movie party ever
event.description:
Who wants to see us throw a big-ass movie party?!

If that sounds like cool beans to you, then join us for HOT ROD, the supremely goofy cult classic about a small-town stuntman from the guys of The Lonely Island.

We think it‚Äôs absurdist perfection, so put on your most patriotic jumpsuit and strap in for a movie party for all you daredevils out there. We‚Äôll have custom bandanas, fake mustaches (all great men have them), and even different souls of the animal kingdom so you can choose the one that best represents you while you live your dream of feeling like a stuntperson without having to actually do any, you know, stunts.

So if you like to party, join us for a daring, action-packed movie party celebrating one of the most underrated comedies ever made.

show.title: Presence
show.headline: A chilling first-person ghost story from Steven Soderbergh

event.title: <show-title>Presence</show-title> <event-type-title>DEAD Talk Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Is Alamo Drafthouse haunted? Find out with a real paranormal investigator.
event.description: Are ghosts really walking among us? Make your moviegoing experience even spookier at our exclusive DEAD Talk screening (Discussing Existence After Death), where a paranormal investigator will conduct a live ghost-hunting showcase after the movie. They‚Äôll explain how modern ghost hunting works, demonstrate some of their tech, and maybe even commune with a specter or two. Your ticket gets you a wristband for the demonstration and a drink at the bar. So leave your disbelief at the door, open yourself to the other side, and join us for an evening of ghostly chills, both on and off the screen.

event.description: COMPANION is a new kind of love story from the unhinged creators of BARBARIAN, so it goes without saying that you can expect a twist or two. If you‚Äôd rather not risk getting spoiled on some of the wildest turns we‚Äôve seen in a good long while, then don‚Äôt miss our exclusive COMPANION Advance Screening. It‚Äôs got all the thrills and chills genre fiends crave and gets two big thumbs up from our friends at Fantastic Fest.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
